source_sentence: 龍王兄弟經
translation: Sutra of the Nāgârjuna Brothers

source_sentence: 吳月支優婆塞支謙譯
translation: Wu Yuezhi Upāsaka Zhiqian Translation

source_sentence: 聞如是：一時佛在舍衛國祇洹阿難邠低阿藍。
translation: Thus I heard: One time, the Buddha was staying at Āpaṇḍa and Āpaṇḍa's grove in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 時有無央數比丘僧，皆阿羅漢也。
translation: There were an incalculably large number of monks and nuns, all arhats.

source_sentence: 阿難邠低至佛所，作禮，却坐。
translation: Ānanda Pūrṇa went to the Buddha, paid homage, and withdrew to sit down.

source_sentence: 佛言：「人當布施、持戒、忍辱、精進、禪定、智慧。」
translation: The Buddha said, "A person must be generous, observe precepts, be patient, be diligent, meditate, and be wise."

source_sentence: 阿難邠低聞之歡喜，即起白佛：「明旦請佛及比丘僧降德到舍，設麁食。」
translation: Hearing this, Ānanda Pūrṇa rejoiced and rose to tell the Buddha, "Tomorrow morning, we'll invite the Buddha and the monks and nuns to come down to our abode and serve us a crude meal."

source_sentence: 佛默然。
translation: The Buddha was silent.

source_sentence: 阿難邠低繞佛三匝而去。
translation: Ānanda and Pūrṇa circled the Buddha three times and departed.

source_sentence: 佛告比丘僧：「旦日當上天投日中下，會阿難邠低舍。」
translation: The Buddha told the monks, "On that day, you'll go up to heaven, cast your lot into the middle and lower parts of the sun, and meet Ānanda at his dwelling."

source_sentence: 佛如伸臂頃，即住虛空中。
translation: As soon as the Buddha stretched out his arm, he stood in the sky.

source_sentence: 羅漢名須檀，正衣服，於虛空中，長跪白佛：「我恒上下，未甞冥如今日也。」
translation: A arhat named Sundarī, who was correctly dressed, knelt down long enough in the sky and said to the Buddha, "I've been up and down forever, but I've never seen the sun rise before."

source_sentence: 佛言：「有兩龍王，瞋恚作變，吐氣為雲故也。」
translation: The Buddha said, "There are two dragon kings whose anger acts up, and they exhale air as clouds."

source_sentence: 復有羅漢名愛波，白佛：「欲行止之。」
translation: Another arhat named Aipa said to the Buddha, "I want to stop them in their tracks."

source_sentence: 佛言：「此龍大有威神。
translation: The Buddha said, "This dragon is mighty and powerful.

source_sentence: 汝行者，必當興惡意，出水沒殺天下人民。」
translation: If you do, it will certainly raise ill will and pour out water to kill the people of the world."

source_sentence: 摩訶目揵連復正衣服，長跪虛空中問佛：「今日以冥，不復見須彌山帝釋宮殿下已質樹子。」
translation: Mahāmaudgalyāyana then put on his robes, knelt down in the sky, and asked the Buddha, "Today, in the dark, I don't see the palace of Indra on Mount Sumeru anymore, even though his highness is a son of the rosary tree."

source_sentence: 佛言：「有兩龍王，一名難頭，二名和難，大瞋恚言：『何等沙門欲飛過，摩我頭上？』
translation: The Buddha said, "There were two dragon kings, one named Nandi and the other named Hetan, who were furious and said, 'What kind of ascetic would want to fly over and touch my head?'

source_sentence: 龍身繞須彌山七匝，以頭覆其上，吐氣出霧故冥。」
translation: The dragon's body circles Mount Sumeru seven times, covers it with its head, and exhales air that emits mist."

source_sentence: 目連白佛：「欲往訶止之。」
translation: Maudgalyāyana said to the Buddha, "I want to go there and stop it."

source_sentence: 佛言：「大善！」
translation: The Buddha said, "Very good!"

source_sentence: 目連繞佛三匝而行。
translation: Maudgalyāyana circled the Buddha three times and walked around him.

source_sentence: 釋提桓因從八萬八千玉女，於後園相娛樂。
translation: Śakrodevānāmī and his entourage of 88,000 jade maidens entertained each other in the backyard.

source_sentence: 目連先過其所，天帝迎之，稽首作禮。
translation: Mucilin passed by first, was greeted by the gods, and paid homage by prostrating himself.

source_sentence: 相問訊已，乃到龍所。
translation: After exchanging greetings, he went to the dragon's quarters.

source_sentence: 兩龍見之，大怒，便變化出煙，須臾復出火。
translation: When the two dragons saw him, they became furious and changed into smoke, and in a moment's time fire came out again.

source_sentence: 目連以佛意，亦變化出烟必繞兩龍三重。
translation: With the Buddha's intention, Maudgalyāyana also conjured up smoke that would surely circle the two dragons three times.

source_sentence: 稍前分身入兩龍身中，右目入，左目出；左目入，右目出；右耳入，左耳出；左耳入，右耳出；復入右鼻，左鼻出；入左鼻，右鼻出，飛入其口中。
translation: A little while ago, he split his body and entered the bodies of the two dragons, letting his right eye enter and his left eye exit; his left eye enter and his right eye exit; his right ear enter and his left ear exit; his left ear enter and his right ear exit; he then entered his right nose and his left nose exited; he entered his left nose and his right nose exited, and flew into his mouth.

source_sentence: 兩龍謂目連在其腹中也。
translation: These two dragons are called the eye-link in their bellies.

source_sentence: 目連亦復作龍身，繞兩龍十四重，以頭覆須彌及兩龍。
translation: Mucilin then again assumed the body of a dragon and circled the two dragons 14 times, covering Sumeru and the two dragons with his head.

source_sentence: 兩龍於下悚慄，延動須彌山，以尾搏扇海水，百獸震怖。
translation: The two dragons were terrified as they moved down, extended Mount Sumeru, and lashed the water with their tails, causing a hundred animals to shudder.

source_sentence: 佛遙告目連：「此龍今當能出水沒壞天下。
translation: The Buddha told Maudgalyāyana, "Now, this dragon will be able to break out of the water and destroy the whole world.

source_sentence: 汝且須止！」
translation: You must stop now!"

source_sentence: 目連言：「我從佛聞知此法。
translation: Maudgalyāyana said, "I've heard about this teaching from the Buddha.

source_sentence: 我有四神足，當信持行之。
translation: I have the four miraculous powers, and I will faithfully maintain and practice them.

source_sentence: 我能取是兩龍及須彌山，著掌中跳過他方天下；亦能取劑磨須彌山，令碎如塵；復能磨須彌山及下地，令萬民不覺之。」
translation: I can take these two dragons and Mount Sumeru and put them in my palm and leap across the whole world; I can also take this medicine and grind Mount Sumeru until it crumbles like dust; and I can grind Mount Sumeru and the ground beneath it so that millions of people won't realize it."

source_sentence: 兩龍恐懼，稽首。
translation: The two dragons were terrified and bowed their heads.

source_sentence: 目連復沙門身。
translation: Mucilin then returned to his ascetic body.

source_sentence: 兩龍化作人，為目連作禮悔過。
translation: The two dragons transformed into men and paid homage to Maudgalyāyana, repenting their transgressions.

source_sentence: 目連將至佛所。
translation: Moulian was about to go to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 兩龍言：「我迷狂惑，不知尊神，觸犯雷震，哀原其罪！」
translation: The two dragons said, "I was deluded and confused, didn't know who the gods were, and violated Lei Chen; forgive me for forgiving them!"

source_sentence: 便受五戒而去。
translation: He then took the five precepts and departed.

source_sentence: 阿難邠低到精舍，索佛及比丘僧，了不見一人，便長跪白佛：「飯具以嚴辦，佛可自屈。」
translation: Ānanda went down to the monastery, looked for the Buddha and the monks, but when he didn't see anyone, he knelt down long enough to tell the Buddha, "The meal preparation is complete, so the Buddha can condescend to us."

source_sentence: 佛即下到其舍。
translation: The Buddha then went down to his dwelling.

source_sentence: 飯已，阿難邠低言：「我求佛不見。
translation: After the meal was finished, Ānanda said to him, "I didn't see the Buddha when I asked for him.

source_sentence: 佛從何所來？」
translation: Where did the Buddha come from?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「目連與兩龍王共諍，適從天上來下。」
translation: The Buddha said, "Maudgalyāyana was engaged in a dispute with two dragon kings who had come down from heaven."

source_sentence: 問：「誰勝者？」
translation: He asked, "Who was the superior one?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「目連。」
translation: The Buddha said, "Maudgalyāyana!"

source_sentence: 阿難邠低言：「善哉！
translation: Ānanda Pūrṇa said, "Good!

source_sentence: 善哉！
translation: Bravo!

source_sentence: 此龍乘戒堅強，失之毫數，罪至於龍，威神尊重。
translation: This is a strong dragon who rides the precepts, and if he loses even a fraction of a second, his offense reaches the dragon, and his authority and spirit are respected.

source_sentence: 目連迺臣伏之乎！
translation: Would Mucilinda submit to him?

source_sentence: 我從今日始，請佛及比丘僧宣揚目連功德。」
translation: From this day forward, I'll ask the Buddha and the monks to proclaim Maudgalyāyana's merits."

source_sentence: 佛呪願迦羅越阿難邠低：「汝前後飯食得道人，善鬼神當擁護汝家，皆令安隱。」
translation: The Buddha incantation vowed to Kālāpanna Abhinavêndra, "Supper and food before and after you attain enlightenment, and the good spirits will support your household and make it peaceful."

source_sentence: 阿難邠低作禮而去。
translation: Ānanda Pingu made obeisance and departed.

source_sentence: 龍王兄弟經
translation: Sutra of the Brothers of the Dragon King
